p: As shown in Table 5, ginger rhizomes essential oil at the doses used had no significant (P>0.05) effect on egg production and weekly mass of eggs. The egg weights recorded in all treated groups of quails were increased significantly (p<0.05) compared to that of birds in control group. Yolk weight was not significantly (p>0.05) influenced by the oral administration of ginger rhizomes essential oil. However, it tends to increase whatever the dose of essential oil compared to the control. The yolk weight is positively and significantly correlated to the egg weight ( œÅ = +0.96; P <0.05) ( Table 6).
